title: Extract job metadata and requirements from markdown before HTML stripping
description:
Restructure the job analysis pipeline to convert HTML to markdown first, then use an LLM sub-agent to extract structured data before stripping to plain text.

Pipeline order:
1. HTML → markdown (local, using markdownify/html2text)
2. LLM sub-agent analyzes markdown to extract:
   - Location label (Seattle/Remote/Review for location)
   - Job type (Full-time/Contract/Part-time)
   - Pay range (salary or hourly)
   - Contract duration (if applicable)
   - Hard requirements (required qualifications, must-haves)
   - Soft requirements (preferred qualifications, nice-to-haves)
3. Store plain text version for display

Database changes:
- Add hard_requirements TEXT column to jobs table
- Add soft_requirements TEXT column to jobs table

If no requirements can be extracted from the posting, tag the job for follow-up review.

Rationale: Markdown preserves semantic structure (headers, lists, bold) that helps the LLM distinguish sections and requirement types, without the token overhead of raw HTML.

   - Pay range alignment with expectations
   - Requirements match percentage
   - Company/role fit assessment

2. UI components:

   - Reason tracking for rejections (helps refine future filtering)

   - Comparison view for similar positions

   - Identify patterns in rejected jobs
   - Surface jobs marked as 'maybe' for review

4. Analytics:
   - Show decision patterns over time
   - Identify common rejection reasons
   - Help refine job filtering criteria
   - Track application rate

This helps maintain focus on best-fit positions and improves filtering over time.

title: Interview stage workflow
description:
Create a workflow to track jobs through the interview pipeline stages.

Interview stages to track:
1. Applied - Application submitted
2. Recruiter screen - Initial HR/recruiter call
3. Hiring manager screen - First interview with hiring manager
4. Technical interview - Skills assessment/technical screen
5. Team interviews - Interviews with potential teammates
6. Final interview - Last round (often with senior leadership)
7. Offer - Offer received
8. Rejected - Rejected at any stage

Features needed:
1. Stage tracking:
   - Current stage for each job
   - Date/time of each stage completion
   - Next scheduled interview details
   - Stage-specific notes

2. UI components:
   - Visual pipeline/kanban view
   - Stage progression buttons
   - Interview scheduling integration
   - Rejection tracking with stage and reason

3. Interview preparation:
   - Link to job requirements for review
   - Company research notes
   - Interview questions/answers preparation
   - Follow-up tracking

4. Analytics:
   - Conversion rates between stages
   - Time spent in each stage
   - Success patterns
   - Common rejection points

This provides visibility into active interviews and helps prioritize preparation.

title: Practice interview videos
description:
Create a feature for recording and reviewing practice interview responses.

Features needed:
1. Video recording:
   - Record responses to interview questions
   - Webcam and microphone integration
   - Timer display during recording
   - Ability to re-record responses

2. Question prompts:
   - Display question on screen during recording
   - Pull from question bank
   - Support for timed responses (e.g., 2-minute behavioral answers)
   - Random question mode for practice

3. Review and analysis:
   - Playback recorded videos
   - Self-assessment notes
   - Track improvement over time
   - Compare multiple takes

4. AI-powered feedback (optional future enhancement):
   - Analyze speech patterns (filler words, pace, clarity)
   - Evaluate body language and eye contact
   - Suggest improvements
   - Transcript generation

5. Organization:
   - Associate videos with specific jobs/companies
   - Categorize by question type
   - Tag with preparation topics
   - Archive old recordings

Benefits:
- Build confidence through practice
- Identify nervous habits or speech patterns
- Refine answers before real interviews
- Track improvement over time
- Prepare for video interviews

Storage considerations:
- Videos can be large files
- May need cloud storage or local file management
- Consider compression options

title: feat(rss): fetch jobs since last download

- Last-run timestamp persisted (db or config) per feed
- Fetches only new jobs since last-run; falls back to full fetch if missing
- Deduplication/upsert by URL preserved
- Tests or dry-run available to verify behavior

Implementation notes:
- Update rss_job_feed.py to write/read last-run timestamps
- Use feed entry published/updated dates when available; fallback to fetched time
- Ensure backward compatibility for existing CSV/DB ingestion
close_reason: Implemented incremental RSS fetching with per-feed last-fetch timestamps stored in feed_fetch_log table. Tests added and passing.
